item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Sometimes I have loved the peacefulness of an ordinary Sunday. It is like standing in a newly planted garden after a warm rain. You can feel the silent and invisible life." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "And it is you, spirit--with will and energy, and virtue and purity--that I want, not alone with your brittle frame." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "It is remarkable how I am never quite clear about the motives for any of my decisions. Is that a sign of confusion or inner dishonesty or is it a sign that we are guided without our knowing or is it both ...The reasons one gives for an action to others and to one's self are certainly inadequate. One can give a reason for everything. In the last resort one acts from a level which remains hidden from us. So one can only ask God to judge us and to forgive us.... At the end of the day I can only ask God to give a merciful judgement on today and all its decisions. It is now in his hand." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer
